item.title: Favorite Theorems and Equations
item.description: Table of Contents The Yoneda Lemma The Tensor-Hom Adjunction Classification of commutative Frobenius algbebras Here are some of my favorite theorems and equations. The Yoneda Lemma Let \( \mathsf{C} \) be a locally small category and \( F : \mathsf{C} \to \mathsf{Set} \) be a functor. Then \[ \operatorname*{Hom}(\operatorname*{Hom}(X,-),F) \cong FX \] and this isomorphism is natural in both \(X\) and \(F\). Comments: This theorem is remarkable. The object on the left, as a collection of natural transformations, is seemingly incalculably large.
